description: A walking tour to see a number of co-designed projects completed by Haringey Council by working with Wood Green's local community. Including community parklets, two large murals, a new café, and the award winning Rising Green Youth Hub.

factsheet.heading: Wood Green Placemaking Walking Tour
paragraphs: In partnership with the community, Haringey Council has created a vision for the future of Wood Green called ‘Shaping Wood Green’ which is underpinned by a series of six themes for improvement, and five placemaking areas of transformation.

Join us to explore Wood Green and see how we are reimaging our local area through public realm and mural projects. During the walk we will guide you around recently completed placemaking projects in Wood Green town centre, featuring the  award-winning, co-designed Rising Green Youth Hub by Freehaus; Roj Cafe and Gladstone Pocket Park by Jan Kattein Architects; and co-designed murals by Anna Nicolò and Mat Dosa and pocket parks by Muf and Jan Kattein Architects.
The tour will start at Café Roj in Ducketts Common and finish at Wood Green Underground station.

location.address: Roj Café, Ducketts Common Park, N8 0EP
travel_info: Additional travel info: The tour will start at Café Roj in Ducketts Common and finish at Wood Green Underground station.

name: Wood Green Placemaking Walking Tour
